{"type":"row","data":{"table":"options","row":{"option_id":"727","option_name":"opanda_privacy_policy_text","option_value":"<h2>Privacy Policy<\/h2>\r\n<p><em>This privacy policy has been compiled to better serve those who are concerned with how their 'Personally identifiable information' (PII) is being used online. PII, as used in US privacy law and information security, is information that can be used on its own or with other information to identify, contact, or locate a single person, or to identify an individual in context.<\/em><\/p>\r\n<p>Please read our privacy policy carefully to get a clear understanding of how we collect, use, protect or otherwise handle your Personally Identifiable Information in accordance with our website.<\/p>\r\n<h4>What personal information do we collect from the people that visit our blog, website or app?<\/h4>\r\n<p>When using our site, as appropriate, you may be asked to enter your name, email address or other details to help you with your experience.<\/p>\r\n<h4>How do we use your information?<\/h4>\r\n<p>We may use the information we collect from you when you register, make a purchase, sign up for our newsletter, unlock the content, respond to a survey or marketing communication, surf the website, or use certain other site features in the following ways:<\/p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>To personalize user's experience and to allow us to deliver the type of content and product offerings in which you are most interested<\/li>\r\n<li>To improve our website in order to better serve you.<\/li>\r\n<li>To allow us to better service you in responding to your customer service requests.<\/li>\r\n<li>To administer a contest, promotion, survey or other site feature.<\/li>\r\n<li>To send periodic emails regarding your order or other products and services.<\/li>\r\n<\/ul>\r\n<h4>Do we use 'cookies'?<\/h4>\r\n<p>Yes. Cookies are small files that a site or its service provider transfers to your computer's hard drive through your Web browser (if you allow) that enables the site's or service provider's systems to recognize your browser and capture and remember certain information. For instance, we use cookies to help us remember and process the items in your shopping cart. They are also used to help us understand your preferences based on previous or current site activity, which enables us to provide you with improved services. We also use cookies to help us compile aggregate data about site traffic and site interaction so that we can offer better site experiences and tools in the future.<\/p>\r\n<p>We use cookies to:<\/p>\r\n<ul>\r\n<li>Understand and save user's preferences for future visits.<\/li>\r\n<li>Memorize the users who have unlocked access to premium content.<\/li>\r\n<\/ul>\r\n<p>If you disable cookies off, some features will be disabled. It will affect the users experience and some of our services will not function properly.<\/p>\r\n<h4>Third Party Disclosure<\/h4>\r\n<p>We do not sell, trade, or otherwise transfer to outside parties your personally identifiable information unless we provide you with advance notice. This does not include website hosting partners and other parties who assist us in operating our website, conducting our business, or servicing you, so long as those parties agree to keep this information confidential. We may also release your information when we believe release is appropriate to comply with the law, enforce our site policies, or protect ours or others' rights, property, or safety.<\/p>\r\n<p>However, non-personally identifiable visitor information may be provided to other parties for marketing, advertising, or other uses.<\/p>\r\n<h4>Third party links<\/h4>\r\n<p>Occasionally, at our discretion, we may include or offer third party products or services on our website. These third party sites have separate and independent privacy policies. We therefore have no responsibility or liability for the content and activities of these linked sites. Nonetheless, we seek to protect the integrity of our site and welcome any feedback about these sites.<\/p>\r\n<p>If there are any questions regarding this privacy policy you may contact us.<\/p>","autoload":"yes"}}}

It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:\n\n<blockquote>Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like pi&#241;a coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)<\/blockquote>\n\n...or something like this:\n\n<blockquote>The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.<\/blockquote>\n\nAs a new WordPress user, you should go to <a href=\"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/wp-admin\/\">your dashboard<\/a> to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Excepteur sint occaecat cupidatat non proident, sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollit anim id est laborum.\"\r\n<h3>Section 1.10.32 of \"de Finibus Bonorum et Malorum\", written by Cicero in 45 BC<\/h3>\r\n\"Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit, sed quia consequuntur magni dolores eos qui ratione voluptatem sequi nesciunt. Neque porro quisquam est, qui dolorem ipsum quia dolor sit amet, consectetur, adipisci velit, sed quia non numquam eius modi tempora incidunt ut labore et dolore magnam aliquam quaerat voluptatem. Ut enim ad minima veniam, quis nostrum exercitationem ullam corporis suscipit laboriosam, nisi ut aliquid ex ea commodi consequatur? Quis autem vel eum iure reprehenderit qui in ea voluptate velit esse quam nihil molestiae consequatur, vel illum qui dolorem eum fugiat quo voluptas nulla pariatur?\"\r\n<h3>1914 translation by H. Rackham<\/h3>\r\n\"But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure?\"","post_title":"A OpenLoad Movie Embed","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"a-openload-movie-embed","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:24:50","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:24:50","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=13","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"25","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-17 08:12:28","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-17 08:12:28","post_content":"We test the PlayStation Vita, Nintendo 3DS and more to find the console that offers the best screen, controls, and games.\r\n\r\nSubscribe: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/subscription_center?add_user=theverge\r\n\r\nVideo games are welcome at the table of popular art, alongside movies, music, and television. Home consoles get a lot of attention, but portable gaming has done the heavy lifting when it comes to expanding the reach and acceptance of the medium.\r\n\r\nThe road to ubiquity began with the peculiar rise of the Game Boy. An outdated piece of hardware upon its release in 1989, Nintendo would nonetheless sell over 115 million Game Boys and Game Boy Colors. Nintendo advertised the portable as a hobby device not just for the kids, but for the family. Countless adults lots entire nights to Zelda and Tetris.\r\n\r\nSince the late 2000s, smartphones have spread across the world at a rate that flounders Nintendo\u2019s hardware. Millions of people who never owned a home or mobile game console now do, and the thousands of good, bad, and somewhere in between smartphone games have become a preferred distraction for grown-ups passing a long commute or a quick smoke break.\r\n\r\nHere\u2019s the problem: Today, most of us play games, but not all of us play the best games on the best consoles that best match our interests. We get comfy with the latest free thing and make do. Why compromise?\r\n\r\nThere are four mobile gaming options available, all exceptional. I will be talking about these machines purely as game playing devices, so whether or not the hardware can also make a call or order Seamless is entirely irrelevant.\r\n\r\nI don\u2019t want to settle for okay. I want the closest to perfect mobile video game system.\r\n\r\nCheck out our full video catalog: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/theverge\/videos\r\nVisit our playlists: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/theverge\/playlists\r\nLike The Verge on Facebook: http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/verge\r\nFollow on Twitter: http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/verge\r\nFollow on Instagram: http:\/\/www.instagram.com\/verge\r\nRead More: http:\/\/www.theverge.com","post_title":"The best portable game console","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"the-best-portable-game-console","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-17 08:14:27","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-17 08:14:27","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=25","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

Home consoles get a lot of attention, but portable gaming has done the heavy lifting when it comes to expanding the reach and acceptance of the medium.\n\nThe road to ubiquity began with the peculiar rise of the Game Boy. An outdated piece of hardware upon its release in 1989, Nintendo would nonetheless sell over 115 million Game Boys and Game Boy Colors. Nintendo advertised the portable as a hobby device not just for the kids, but for the family. Countless adults lots entire nights to Zelda and Tetris.\n\nSince the late 2000s, smartphones have spread across the world at a rate that flounders Nintendo\u2019s hardware. Millions of people who never owned a home or mobile game console now do, and the thousands of good, bad, and somewhere in between smartphone games have become a preferred distraction for grown-ups passing a long commute or a quick smoke break.\n\nHere\u2019s the problem: Today, most of us play games, but not all of us play the best games on the best consoles that best match our interests. We get comfy with the latest free thing and make do. Why compromise?\n\nThere are four mobile gaming options available, all exceptional. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"29","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-17 08:14:27","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-17 08:14:27","post_content":"We test the PlayStation Vita, Nintendo 3DS and more to find the console that offers the best screen, controls, and games.\r\n\r\nSubscribe: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/subscription_center?add_user=theverge\r\n\r\nVideo games are welcome at the table of popular art, alongside movies, music, and television. Home consoles get a lot of attention, but portable gaming has done the heavy lifting when it comes to expanding the reach and acceptance of the medium.\r\n\r\nThe road to ubiquity began with the peculiar rise of the Game Boy. An outdated piece of hardware upon its release in 1989, Nintendo would nonetheless sell over 115 million Game Boys and Game Boy Colors. Nintendo advertised the portable as a hobby device not just for the kids, but for the family. Countless adults lots entire nights to Zelda and Tetris.\r\n\r\nSince the late 2000s, smartphones have spread across the world at a rate that flounders Nintendo\u2019s hardware. Millions of people who never owned a home or mobile game console now do, and the thousands of good, bad, and somewhere in between smartphone games have become a preferred distraction for grown-ups passing a long commute or a quick smoke break.\r\n\r\nHere\u2019s the problem: Today, most of us play games, but not all of us play the best games on the best consoles that best match our interests. We get comfy with the latest free thing and make do. Why compromise?\r\n\r\nThere are four mobile gaming options available, all exceptional. I will be talking about these machines purely as game playing devices, so whether or not the hardware can also make a call or order Seamless is entirely irrelevant.\r\n\r\nI don\u2019t want to settle for okay. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"236","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:07:27","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:07:27","post_content":"BEST VIEWED IN HD, FULLSCREEN, SCALING OFF<br \/>  <br \/>  Follow me at: <br \/>  Twitter  - http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/scientifantasti | Instagram  - http:\/\/instagram.com\/scientifantastic | Google+  - http:\/\/gplus.to\/scientifantastic<br \/>  <br \/>  I was lucky enough to be sent to Rio on assignment to shoot some Ultra HD 4K and 8K timelapse footage for a major electronics manufacturer. This video is a compilation of some of the footage I shot there. Most of the locations are within the city of Rio De Janeiro, but I also traveled to the famous Iguaz\u00fa Falls on the border of the Brazilian state of Paran\u00e1 and the Argentinian province of Misiones. In 2011 Iguaz\u00fa Falls was announced as one of the seven winners of the New Seven Wonders of Nature by the New Seven Wonders of the World Foundation.<br \/>  <br \/>  RIO DE JANEIRO<br \/>  No wonder the beautiful city of Rio De Janeiro was chosen to host the 2014 FIFA World Cup and the 2016 Summer Olympics. Rio de Janeiro, or simply Rio, is the capital city of the State of Rio de Janeiro, the second largest city of Brazil, and the third largest metropolitan area and agglomeration in South America, boasting approximately 6.3 million people within the city proper. Part of the city has been designated as a World Heritage Site, named \"Rio de Janeiro: Carioca Landscapes between the Mountain and the Sea\", identified by UNESCO in the category Cultural Landscape.<br \/>  <br \/>  Rio de Janeiro is one of the most visited cities in the southern hemisphere and is known for its natural settings, carnival celebrations, samba, Bossa Nova, balneario beaches such as Barra da Tijuca, Copacabana, Ipanema, and Leblon. Some of the most famous landmarks in addition to the beaches include the giant statue of Christ the Redeemer (\"Cristo Redentor\") atop Corcovado mountain, named one of the New Seven Wonders of the World; Sugarloaf mountain (P\u00e3o de A\u00e7\u00facar) with its cable car; the Samb\u00f3dromo, a permanent grandstand-lined parade avenue which is used during Carnival; and Maracan\u00e3 Stadium, one of the world's largest football stadiums.<br \/>  <br \/>  I hope you enjoy the video! <br \/>  <br \/>  Camera Gear:<br \/>  Canon 5DIII<br \/>  Canon 5DII<br \/>  PhaseOne IQ180<br \/>  Various Canon lenses<br \/>  <br \/>  Music By: <br \/>  Jan Baumann - http:\/\/www.baumann-musik.de<br \/>  <br \/>  Special thanks to:<br \/>  My production assistant Jos\u00e9 Ol\u00edmpio ( www.joseolimpio.com ). Without his help this video would not have been possible. If you are ever in Rio and need a local production person I highly recommend Jos\u00e9. <br \/>  <br \/>  Dynamic Perception - http:\/\/www.dynamicperception.com <br \/>  Division Camera  - http:\/\/www.divisioncamera.com <br \/>  Digital Fusion - http:\/\/www.digitalfusion.net <br \/>  Jag35 - http:\/\/www.jag35.com<br \/>  <br \/>  YOU CAN FOLLOW ME AT:<br \/>  Twitter         - http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/scientifantasti<br \/>  Instagram  - http:\/\/instagram.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  Vimeo         - http:\/\/www.vimeo.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  Facebook   - http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/pages\/Scientifantastic\/163137190447579<br \/>  Google+     - http:\/\/gplus.to\/scientifantastic<br \/>  500px          - http:\/\/500px.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  ProPic         - http:\/\/propic.com\/scientifantastic","post_title":"RIO - 8K","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"rio-8k","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=236","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"238","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_content":"BEST VIEWED IN HD, FULLSCREEN, SCALING OFF<br \/>  <br \/>  Follow me at: <br \/>  Twitter  - http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/scientifantasti | Instagram  - http:\/\/instagram.com\/scientifantastic | Google+  - http:\/\/gplus.to\/scientifantastic<br \/>  <br \/>  I was lucky enough to be sent to Rio on assignment to shoot some Ultra HD 4K and 8K timelapse footage for a major electronics manufacturer. This video is a compilation of some of the footage I shot there. Most of the locations are within the city of Rio De Janeiro, but I also traveled to the famous Iguaz\u00fa Falls on the border of the Brazilian state of Paran\u00e1 and the Argentinian province of Misiones. In 2011 Iguaz\u00fa Falls was announced as one of the seven winners of the New Seven Wonders of Nature by the New Seven Wonders of the World Foundation.<br \/>  <br \/>  RIO DE JANEIRO<br \/>  No wonder the beautiful city of Rio De Janeiro was chosen to host the 2014 FIFA World Cup and the 2016 Summer Olympics. Rio de Janeiro, or simply Rio, is the capital city of the State of Rio de Janeiro, the second largest city of Brazil, and the third largest metropolitan area and agglomeration in South America, boasting approximately 6.3 million people within the city proper. Part of the city has been designated as a World Heritage Site, named \"Rio de Janeiro: Carioca Landscapes between the Mountain and the Sea\", identified by UNESCO in the category Cultural Landscape.<br \/>  <br \/>  Rio de Janeiro is one of the most visited cities in the southern hemisphere and is known for its natural settings, carnival celebrations, samba, Bossa Nova, balneario beaches such as Barra da Tijuca, Copacabana, Ipanema, and Leblon. Some of the most famous landmarks in addition to the beaches include the giant statue of Christ the Redeemer (\"Cristo Redentor\") atop Corcovado mountain, named one of the New Seven Wonders of the World; Sugarloaf mountain (P\u00e3o de A\u00e7\u00facar) with its cable car; the Samb\u00f3dromo, a permanent grandstand-lined parade avenue which is used during Carnival; and Maracan\u00e3 Stadium, one of the world's largest football stadiums.<br \/>  <br \/>  I hope you enjoy the video! <br \/>  <br \/>  Camera Gear:<br \/>  Canon 5DIII<br \/>  Canon 5DII<br \/>  PhaseOne IQ180<br \/>  Various Canon lenses<br \/>  <br \/>  Music By: <br \/>  Jan Baumann - http:\/\/www.baumann-musik.de<br \/>  <br \/>  Special thanks to:<br \/>  My production assistant Jos\u00e9 Ol\u00edmpio ( www.joseolimpio.com ). Without his help this video would not have been possible. If you are ever in Rio and need a local production person I highly recommend Jos\u00e9. <br \/>  <br \/>  Dynamic Perception - http:\/\/www.dynamicperception.com <br \/>  Division Camera  - http:\/\/www.divisioncamera.com <br \/>  Digital Fusion - http:\/\/www.digitalfusion.net <br \/>  Jag35 - http:\/\/www.jag35.com<br \/>  <br \/>  YOU CAN FOLLOW ME AT:<br \/>  Twitter         - http:\/\/www.twitter.com\/scientifantasti<br \/>  Instagram  - http:\/\/instagram.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  Vimeo         - http:\/\/www.vimeo.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  Facebook   - http:\/\/www.facebook.com\/pages\/Scientifantastic\/163137190447579<br \/>  Google+     - http:\/\/gplus.to\/scientifantastic<br \/>  500px          - http:\/\/500px.com\/scientifantastic<br \/>  ProPic         - http:\/\/propic.com\/scientifantastic","post_title":"RIO - 8K","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"236-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:07:32","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"236","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/236-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"251","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:09:34","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:09:34","post_content":" ","post_title":"MTV &#8220;Group Hug&#8221;","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"mtv-group-hug-2","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:09:34","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:09:34","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"248","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/mtv-group-hug\/mtv-group-hug-2\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"attachment","post_mime_type":"image\/jpeg","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"252","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:10:13","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:10:13","post_content":"Glassworks Amsterdam is very proud to have collaborated with the G-Star in-house creative team to realize the Art of RAW campaign film. Till now the global campaigns of the brand were based  on iconic print advertisements, shot by one of the biggest names in photography Anton Corbijn, featuring talents like Liv Tyler, Magnus Carlsen and Gemma Arterton.<br \/>  <br \/>  We were therefore extremely excited when G-Star approached Glassworks to realize their first ever campaign commercial which will run online and in cinemas across the globe. Since the brand took a break from conventional advertising in their market, this was a great opportunity for the two brand\u2019s expertise to meet: denim and high-end digital animation and visual effects.<br \/>  <br \/>  The result was a dramatic, fully CGI, macro-level journey through the denim-making process. G-Star's creative team created the concept for the video and collaborated with our in-house CGI director Rudiger Kaltenhauser, who created the magical and moody world for the film, provided that it remained faithful to the core processes involved in creating their world-famous RAW denim. We were completely sold when we knew the challenge was to create a film with a photo-real running skeleton dog and that it would have the soundtrack by US super-producer Skrillex.<br \/>  <br \/>  Rudiger storyboarded the action treatments, designed the style frames, edited the cut, and then led our team of lighting\/texturing TD's and animators in bringing everything to life. There were many challenges, not least of all creating CGI denim that reflects the fabric the brand is so passionate about. The team also took on the challenge to create a texturing\/lighting setup that allowed the beauty of each step of the denim making process to be clearly understood but also live up to the expectations of the G-Star denim specialists.<br \/>  <br \/>  Cut from the 60\" film, a 15\" teaser was screened to launch their show at the Bread & Butter fair in Berlin last month, and whilst the full-length film will be playing on their website, you can see the 30\" in cinemas and throughout their stores globally. The CGI skeleton dog is the leading visual throughout the Art of RAW print campaign and you might even be able to race him yourself in the Hong Kong subway!<br \/>  <br \/>  <br \/>  Production Company <br \/>  Glassworks Amsterdam<br \/>  <br \/>  Director <br \/>  Rudiger Kaltenhauser<br \/>  <br \/>  3d Artist<br \/>  Markus Lauterbach<br \/>  Tim Borgmann<br \/>  Markus Geerts<br \/>  Nick Smalley<br \/>  Tim Bolland<br \/>  Dan Hope<br \/>  Chris Wood<br \/>  <br \/>  Flame artists<br \/>  Kyle Obley<br \/>  Lise Prudh'omme<br \/>  <br \/>  Flame Assist<br \/>  Bob Roijen<br \/>  <br \/>  Grading<br \/>  Scott Harris<br \/>  <br \/>  Executive Producer<br \/>  Jane Bakx<br \/>  <br \/>  <br \/>  Client <br \/>  G-Star RAW<br \/>  <br \/>  Concept<br \/>  G-Star RAW creative team<br \/>  <br \/>  Music<br \/>  Skrillex","post_title":"G-STAR The Art of RAW","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"g-star-the-art-of-raw","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=252","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"254","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_content":"Glassworks Amsterdam is very proud to have collaborated with the G-Star in-house creative team to realize the Art of RAW campaign film. Till now the global campaigns of the brand were based  on iconic print advertisements, shot by one of the biggest names in photography Anton Corbijn, featuring talents like Liv Tyler, Magnus Carlsen and Gemma Arterton.<br \/>  <br \/>  We were therefore extremely excited when G-Star approached Glassworks to realize their first ever campaign commercial which will run online and in cinemas across the globe. Since the brand took a break from conventional advertising in their market, this was a great opportunity for the two brand\u2019s expertise to meet: denim and high-end digital animation and visual effects.<br \/>  <br \/>  The result was a dramatic, fully CGI, macro-level journey through the denim-making process. G-Star's creative team created the concept for the video and collaborated with our in-house CGI director Rudiger Kaltenhauser, who created the magical and moody world for the film, provided that it remained faithful to the core processes involved in creating their world-famous RAW denim. We were completely sold when we knew the challenge was to create a film with a photo-real running skeleton dog and that it would have the soundtrack by US super-producer Skrillex.<br \/>  <br \/>  Rudiger storyboarded the action treatments, designed the style frames, edited the cut, and then led our team of lighting\/texturing TD's and animators in bringing everything to life. There were many challenges, not least of all creating CGI denim that reflects the fabric the brand is so passionate about. The team also took on the challenge to create a texturing\/lighting setup that allowed the beauty of each step of the denim making process to be clearly understood but also live up to the expectations of the G-Star denim specialists.<br \/>  <br \/>  Cut from the 60\" film, a 15\" teaser was screened to launch their show at the Bread & Butter fair in Berlin last month, and whilst the full-length film will be playing on their website, you can see the 30\" in cinemas and throughout their stores globally. The CGI skeleton dog is the leading visual throughout the Art of RAW print campaign and you might even be able to race him yourself in the Hong Kong subway!<br \/>  <br \/>  <br \/>  Production Company <br \/>  Glassworks Amsterdam<br \/>  <br \/>  Director <br \/>  Rudiger Kaltenhauser<br \/>  <br \/>  3d Artist<br \/>  Markus Lauterbach<br \/>  Tim Borgmann<br \/>  Markus Geerts<br \/>  Nick Smalley<br \/>  Tim Bolland<br \/>  Dan Hope<br \/>  Chris Wood<br \/>  <br \/>  Flame artists<br \/>  Kyle Obley<br \/>  Lise Prudh'omme<br \/>  <br \/>  Flame Assist<br \/>  Bob Roijen<br \/>  <br \/>  Grading<br \/>  Scott Harris<br \/>  <br \/>  Executive Producer<br \/>  Jane Bakx<br \/>  <br \/>  <br \/>  Client <br \/>  G-Star RAW<br \/>  <br \/>  Concept<br \/>  G-Star RAW creative team<br \/>  <br \/>  Music<br \/>  Skrillex","post_title":"G-STAR The Art of RAW","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"252-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:10:16","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"252","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/252-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"266","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:12:34","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:12:34","post_content":"Commercial Trailer for \u00ab le Printemps du Cin\u00e9ma 2013 \u00bb <br \/>  <br \/>  Spring is coming!<br \/>  <br \/>  While one swallow does not a summer make, birds and bees group together to celebrate the coming of spring ! This 3D animation trailer for Cinema Spring (le Printemps du Cin\u00e9ma), a promotional event by FNCF and BNP Paribas, is screened from February to March in every French cinema.<br \/>  <br \/>  Directed by : Blackmeal & Ma\u00ebl Fran\u00e7ois<br \/>  Client : F\u00e9d\u00e9ration Nationale des Cin\u00e9mas Fran\u00e7ais (FNCF)<br \/>  Main coordination : Premium Events<br \/>  Script \/ production coordination : Agence FWD","post_title":"Le Printemps du Cin\u00e9ma : Spring is coming","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"le-printemps-du-cinema-spring-is-coming","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 09:55:00","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 09:55:00","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=266","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"270","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:15:24","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:15:24","post_content":"http:\/\/www.wethinkthings.com<br \/>  facebook.com\/wethinkthings<br \/>  <br \/>  This project was meant to be a promo video for an app quite similar to qype. Sadly we never got to finish it and the app didn't either.<br \/>  <br \/>  The original idea behind it was to \u00bb[\u2026] follow a group of friends from one morning to the next and discover together with them how different the definitions of hot spots can be. Even though these places are so diverse, \"Hot Spots\" manages to unite our group of friends in the end.\u00ab<br \/>  <br \/>  In order to share this with you and prevent the video from gathering too much dust, we replaced every app element and logo in the video and renamed the app to \u00bbHot Spots\u00ab.<br \/>  <br \/>  We hope you like it nonetheless!<br \/>  <br \/>  Client: \u2013<br \/>  <br \/>  Production: Sehsucht, Hamburg<br \/>  Producer: Selina Schmitt<br \/>  <br \/>  Director: Felix Meyer, Pascal Monaco<br \/>  Creative Direction: Felix Meyer, Pascal Monaco<br \/>  Visual Concept, Animation: Felix Meyer, Pascal Monaco","post_title":"Let's Call It \u00bbHot Spots\u00ab","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"lets-call-it-hot-spots","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 03:15:28","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:15:28","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=270","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"293","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:19:08","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:19:08","post_content":"This is a great little short trailer by the Animation HUB.  http:\/\/www.giant.ie The Animation Hub is collaboration between staff and students of the Irish School of Animation (ISA) at Ballyfermot College of Further Education (BCFE), staff and students of Trinity College's Graphics, Vision and Visualisation Group (GV2) and the recently established animation studio Giant Creative, set up by BCFE graduates.\n\nThe aim of the scheme is to combine the skills and talents of students from both institutions and have them work with an animation studio in Dublin to create an high quality animated short film that would give the students the chance to experience working on a high-end project in a professional environment.\n\nDirected by Giant Creative (giant.ie)\nTrinity College Project Manager Carol O Sullivan (tcd.ie\/)\nBallyfermot College Project Manager Gareth Lee (isa-bcfe.ie\/)\nTechnical Consultant Shane Whelan\nMusic by Epic Soul Factory\nBCFE Students Mark Fisher Owen Maloney\nTCD Students Kenneth Ryall Amy Davidson\n\n'The Animation Hub' (http:\/\/vimeo.com\/animationhub) \nThe Irish School of Animation (http:\/\/isa-bcfe.ie\/), \nBallyfermot College (http:\/\/www.bcfe.ie\/) \n\nBe sure to like this Facebook page - {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"301","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:21:52","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:21:52","post_content":"This week the BBC unveils its marketing campaign and title sequences for the London 2012 Olympics entitled \u201cStadium UK\u201d.  The animation is directed by Passion\u2019s Pete Candeland and the campaign was devised by executive creative director Damon Collins and a team of creatives at Rainey Kelly Campbell Roalfe\/Y&R. The campaign is designed to be used across all the BBC\u2019s television, radio and digital Olympic content and it features specially commissioned music by Elbow.  As well as the 1 x 60 sec trailer there is a 2\u2019 40\u201d film which we will be able to show on Passion\u2019s website on 27th July, the opening night of the Games.","post_title":"BBC 'Stadium UK'","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"bbc-stadium-uk","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 07:28:00","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 07:28:00","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=301","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"311","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 03:54:32","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 03:54:32","post_content":"We test the PlayStation Vita, Nintendo 3DS and more to find the console that offers the best screen, controls, and games.\r\n\r\nSubscribe: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/subscription_center?add_user=theverge\r\n\r\nVideo games are welcome at the table of popular art, alongside movies, music, and television. Home consoles get a lot of attention, but portable gaming has done the heavy lifting when it comes to expanding the reach and acceptance of the medium.\r\n\r\nThe road to ubiquity began with the peculiar rise of the Game Boy. An outdated piece of hardware upon its release in 1989, Nintendo would nonetheless sell over 115 million Game Boys and Game Boy Colors. Nintendo advertised the portable as a hobby device not just for the kids, but for the family. Countless adults lots entire nights to Zelda and Tetris.\r\n\r\nSince the late 2000s, smartphones have spread across the world at a rate that flounders Nintendo\u2019s hardware. Millions of people who never owned a home or mobile game console now do, and the thousands of good, bad, and somewhere in between smartphone games have become a preferred distraction for grown-ups passing a long commute or a quick smoke break.\r\n\r\nHere\u2019s the problem: Today, most of us play games, but not all of us play the best games on the best consoles that best match our interests. We get comfy with the latest free thing and make do. Why compromise?\r\n\r\nThere are four mobile gaming options available, all exceptional. I will be talking about these machines purely as game playing devices, so whether or not the hardware can also make a call or order Seamless is entirely irrelevant.\r\n\r\nI don\u2019t want to settle for okay. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"366","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:39:49","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:39:49","post_content":"If you liked this film - help us make the feature version here: http:\/\/nywift.org\/article.aspx?ID=5574<br \/>  <br \/>  KEEP THE CHANGE is a love story written for and starring adults on the autism spectrum. When David, an upper-class charmer is forced to attend a support group for people with autism, he meets a young woman who challenges his identity as \"normal\". Eventually, David must choose between his playboy persona and the opportunity to make a real connection with someone who can understand him.<br \/>  <br \/>  Written and directed by Rachel Israel. The film won the Columbia University Film Festival\u2019s Focus Features Best Film Award, the Alumni Award, and the Arthur J. Harris Memorial Prize, and has screened at festivals worldwide. {"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"370","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:40:10","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:40:10","post_content":"If you liked this film - help us make the feature version here: http:\/\/nywift.org\/article.aspx?ID=5574\r\n\r\nKEEP THE CHANGE is a love story written for and starring adults on the autism spectrum. When David, an upper-class charmer is forced to attend a support group for people with autism, he meets a young woman who challenges his identity as \"normal\". Eventually, David must choose between his playboy persona and the opportunity to make a real connection with someone who can understand him.\r\n\r\nWritten and directed by Rachel Israel. The film won the Columbia University Film Festival\u2019s Focus Features Best Film Award, the Alumni Award, and the Arthur J. Harris Memorial Prize, and has screened at festivals worldwide. Principal cast: Brandon Polansky and Samantha Elisofon.\r\n\r\nFacebook: https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/keepthechangefilm\r\nTwitter: https:\/\/twitter.com\/ktcfilm","post_title":"Episode 1","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"366-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:40:10","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:40:10","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"366","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/366-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

Filmmaker Riley Blakeway was there to document the journey.\r\n\r\nhttp:\/\/shop.monsterchildren.com\/collections\/featured-products\/products\/issue-45\r\nhttp:\/\/www.monsterchildren.com\/27287\/eight-sand\/","post_title":"Episode 2","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"371-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:41:11","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:11","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"371","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/371-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"376","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:41:38","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:38","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.<br \/> <br \/> Taking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.<br \/> <br \/> This time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.<br \/> <br \/> Ocean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:<br \/> http:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php<br \/> <br \/> The background music is by Redmann<br \/> http:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann <br \/> <br \/> Alex Cherney<br \/> <br \/> http:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Ocean Sky","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"publish","comment_status":"open","ping_status":"open","post_password":"","post_name":"ocean-sky","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"0","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/?p=376","menu_order":"0","post_type":"post","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"378","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:41:40","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:40","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.<br \/> <br \/> Taking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.<br \/> <br \/> This time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.<br \/> <br \/> Ocean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:<br \/> http:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php<br \/> <br \/> The background music is by Redmann<br \/> http:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann <br \/> <br \/> Alex Cherney<br \/> <br \/> http:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Ocean Sky","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"376-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:41:40","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:40","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"376","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/376-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"380","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:41:53","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:53","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.\r\n\r\nTaking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.\r\n\r\nThis time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.\r\n\r\nOcean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:\r\nhttp:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php\r\n\r\nThe background music is by Redmann\r\nhttp:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann\r\n\r\nAlex Cherney\r\n\r\nhttp:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Episode 3","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"376-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:41:53","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:53","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"376","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/376-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"381","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:41:54","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:54","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.<br \/> <br \/> Taking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.<br \/> <br \/> This time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.<br \/> <br \/> Ocean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:<br \/> http:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php<br \/> <br \/> The background music is by Redmann<br \/> http:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann <br \/> <br \/> Alex Cherney<br \/> <br \/> http:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Ocean Sky","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"376-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:41:54","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:41:54","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"376","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/376-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"382","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 04:42:07","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:42:07","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.\r\n\r\nTaking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.\r\n\r\nThis time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.\r\n\r\nOcean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:\r\nhttp:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php\r\n\r\nThe background music is by Redmann\r\nhttp:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann\r\n\r\nAlex Cherney\r\n\r\nhttp:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Episode 3","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"376-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 04:42:07","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 04:42:07","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"376","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/376-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"392","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 05:02:09","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 05:02:09","post_content":"If you liked this film - help us make the feature version here: http:\/\/nywift.org\/article.aspx?ID=5574<br \/>  <br \/>  KEEP THE CHANGE is a love story written for and starring adults on the autism spectrum. When David, an upper-class charmer is forced to attend a support group for people with autism, he meets a young woman who challenges his identity as \"normal\". Eventually, David must choose between his playboy persona and the opportunity to make a real connection with someone who can understand him.<br \/>  <br \/>  Written and directed by Rachel Israel. The film won the Columbia University Film Festival\u2019s Focus Features Best Film Award, the Alumni Award, and the Arthur J. Harris Memorial Prize, and has screened at festivals worldwide. Principal cast: Brandon Polansky and Samantha Elisofon.<br \/>  <br \/>  Facebook: https:\/\/www.facebook.com\/keepthechangefilm<br \/>  Twitter: https:\/\/twitter.com\/ktcfilm","post_title":"Keep the Change","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"366-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 05:02:09","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 05:02:09","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"366","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/366-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}

{"type":"row","data":{"table":"posts","row":{"ID":"394","post_author":"1","post_date":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_date_gmt":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_content":"At a star party in August 2009 I took my first long exposure photograph of the night sky. I was so thrilled with the results that I dedicated most moonless weekends since then to photographing two things I love the most in nature - the night sky and the Ocean.<br \/> <br \/> Taking a series of images and combining them into a time lapse video sequence made it even more interesting. I have since experimented with all-night time lapses, panning motion, etc. But most importantly I've enjoyed the journey immensely.<br \/> <br \/> This time lapse video is the result of almost 1.5 years of work, 31 hours of taking images during six nights on Southern Ocean Coast in Australia.<br \/> <br \/> Ocean Sky was awarded the overall winner prize at STARMUS astrophotography competition:<br \/> http:\/\/www.starmus.com\/pages\/en\/winners-starmus-astro-photography-competition128.php<br \/> <br \/> The background music is by Redmann<br \/> http:\/\/www.toucanmusic.co.uk\/artists\/artist.php?q=Redmann <br \/> <br \/> Alex Cherney<br \/> <br \/> http:\/\/www.terrastro.com","post_title":"Ocean Sky","post_excerpt":"","post_status":"inherit","comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","post_password":"","post_name":"376-revision-v1","to_ping":"","pinged":"","post_modified":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_modified_gmt":"2017-05-18 05:03:04","post_content_filtered":"","post_parent":"376","guid":"http:\/\/localhost\/truemag-demo\/376-revision-v1\/","menu_order":"0","post_type":"revision","post_mime_type":"","comment_count":"0"}}}
